ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed considerable skills and knowledge in wet lab chemistry, including material synthesis, electrode synthesis, and a variety of electrochemical experimental procedures. I also learned about the mechanisms of electrocatalysis.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: There was little to no oversight on my project, with considerable disorganization within the research group. I did not receive much guidance from the PI, or other graduate and post-doctoral students in the group. I would have learned and accomplished a lot more if I had been paired with a student or faculty member who could guide me in the complicated theoretical components to the wet lab work. It was extremely difficult to digest manuscripts independently because the learning curve of the material was extremely steep.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I believe there is a version of this semester of research that is quite smooth and intellectually satisfying, however I did not have this experience. In order for the semester to be successful, the research should be overseen more closely by post-doctoral students or faculty. I enjoyed learning on my own in the wet lab, but would have been able to accomplish something more meaningful with guidance.
